page.title: 03HUNTING TO REHABILITATION
page.content: {Higham Grange}beside the Watling street near{Nuneaton,}originally an old Hunting Lodge and Racing Stable was adapted in 1924 to a {Rehabilitation Centre}for Miners and eventually for anyone.It is now administered by the{Leicestershire {Health Authority. The elegant house and outbuildings stand in an area of 40 hectares. Pleasant gardens surround the Centre and the outlying area contains conifer trees and deciduous woodland.A pond of 2/3 acre is used by the patients for private{fishing}and as an emergency supply of water in the event of fire. An area of grazing ground is let to a neighbouring farmer.The area contains a slurry pit and private sewage works. The house is reputed to be{haunted by a 'Grey Lady', and lute music has been heard by staff in the main hall.
